results.title: Love in a Cold Climate
results.creator_credit: Tom Hooper, Kate Harwood and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Love In A Cold Climate is the story of three girls and their journey into adulthood. What is most important to Polly, Fanny and Linda is their launching into society where they hope to meet future husbands and fall in love along the way. Set in England in the early 1930’s we meet the eccentric families of the girls and travel between the country houses of England to the drawing rooms of London’s high society all in the pursuit of love. Cast includes Elisabeth Dermot-Walsh, Rosamund Pike, Megan Dodds, Anthony Andrews, Alan Bates.

results.title: Love from Guy
results.creator_credit: Sandra Lepore, Carolyn Johnson and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Played out as a series of video confessions, Love from Guy follows the downward trajectory of Guy (Angelo d’Angelo) a likable but conflicted young man from an Italian background. After Guy’s wife walks out on him, he tries to piece together the reasons why she left by recording a video letter intended for her. Director Sandra Lepore’s short drama explores the ambivalence felt by the protagonist as he tries to reconcile his family’s background and conflicting values which are wrecking havoc on his relationship. Cast includes Les Chantery, Francesca Radice, George Rubiu, Gina Bortolin.

results.title: Love Della
results.brief_description: This 1950s style portrait of a young jazz singer will appeal to music fans of all ages. Shot in black and white, and with a clever use of home movie, the mythical story of Della Ray unfolds with a stunning performance from Kate Ceberano as Della.

results.title: Love and anarchy: the wild wild world of Jaimie Leonarder [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Brendan Young, Karena Slaninka, Pagan Films and SBS Independent
results.brief_description: An insightful documentary into the life and background of performer, diversional therapist, broadcaster, street worker, nightclub impresario, film archivist and champion of the marginalised outsider sub-culture, Jaimie Leonarder. His is an amazing story of compassion, obsession and commitment within a culture of outsiders - drug addicts, psychiatric patients, the homeless. His band, the Mu-Mesons, which comprised of ex-psychiatric patients and eccentrics acted as a therapeutical diversion for its members allowing them to perform totally uninhibited, pushing music to its wild limits. The film also explores the relationship between Jaimie and his wife, Aspasia who shares his passion in film collecting and involvement with the outsider community. Through interviews, film excerpts, live band performances and archival footage, director Brendan Young (Three chords and a wardrobe, Boys on film 3) captures the enthusiasm and vitality of this international cult figure who through all his endeavours in the world of the arts and the marginalised, still manages to remain comparatively unknown in his home town Sydney and wider Australia. Contains some b&w footage.

results.title: Love's Labour Lost
results.brief_description: Ferdinand, King of Navarre, and his friends, Berowne of Biron, Longaville, and Dumain, take an oath to eschew themselves to study for three years. But when the charming princess of France arrives with her three ladies the four gentlemen fall in love with the four ladies. Spying on each other the “academics” discover each other’s perfidy and in good spirit decide that love is a lawful part of all study. Learning that the king of France has died, the ladies are obliged to leave, but not before assigning various penances to their suitors and promising to return in one year.

results.title: Loulou [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Maurice Pialat, Klaus Hellwig, Yves Gasser, Action Films and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: A middle-class woman (Isabelle Huppert) leaves her safe long-term relationship with her boss (Guy Marchand) for good sex and a socially-marginal existence with a roughly handsome unemployed working-class man (Gerard Depardieu). Shot largely in long handheld takes, the film posits sex as a force that shatters not only class allegiances and established social patterns but even the order represented by conventional narrative structures. Eliciting spontaneous and improvised performances from his actors, Pialat blends a loosely told love story with an acute social observation of the sexual and social mores of France in the seventies. The characters’ actions and behaviours are presented straightforwardly without moralising, enabling an open-ended exploration of the way class differences play out in power relations between the sexes.

results.title: Louisbourg [French version]
results.creator_credit: Albert Kish, Tom Daly and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Shows the restoration of the Fortress of Louisbourg on Cape Breton Island. The fort, originally built by King Louis XV to protect French possessions in the French Colonial era, is considered to be the largest historical site and dig in North America. A methodological film showing techniques of research involved in reconstructing some of the main buildings.

results.title: Louis Nowra
results.brief_description: Emerging from the last decade as one of Australia’s leading dramatists, Louis Nowra discusses why his plays have been described as “anti-naturalistic”.
